Anggaran Ballpoint APBD DKI Rp 123 miliar, Sekolah Buka Suara
01 Nov 2019, 10:41 by Imam Hamdi, Febriyan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Anggaran pembelian ballpoint dalam rancangan APBD DKI 2020 sebesar Rp 123 miliar yang diajukan Suku Dinas Pendidikan Jakarta Timur menjadi sorotan. Sejumlah sekolah yang Tempo datangi mengaku tak mengerti kenapa anggaran pengadaan alat tulis bisa sebesar itu.
Sekolah Menengah Atas Negeri 9 Jakarta misalnya. SMA di kawasan Kebon Pala, Makasar, tersebut mengajukan anggaran pembelian pulpen Rp 16,3 juta pada rencana kerja dan anggaran sekolah (RKAS) 2020.
Kepala Sekolah Dwi Priyo Eko Santoso merinci anggaran tersebut dibagi dua untuk pembelian pulpen ball liner Rp 10,49 juta dam pulpen Rp 5,82 juga. Adapun pulpen ball liner tersebut diajukan sebanyak lima lusin dikali 12 dan empat pack pulpen dikali 12 bulan. "Pulpen tersebut untuk 60 guru yang mengajar di sekolah kami," kata Eko saat ditemui di kantornya, Kamis, 1 November 2019.
Seorang staf tata usaha SMAN 9 yang namanya tidak mau disebutkan, mengatakan pembelian pulpen masuk dalam anggaran alat tulis kantor. Pembelian ATK tersebut biasanya dilakukan setiap tiga bulan sekali atau triwulan.
Dalam setahun untuk pembelian seluruh ATK seperti pulpen, spidol, pensil, penghapus, tinta, kertas dan lainnya bisa mencapai Rp 150 juta. Menurut staf tata usaha ini, sekolah paling banyak membeli pulpen dalam satu triwulan mencapai Rp 1 juta.
"Itu sudah maksimal banget Rp 1 juta."
Staf itu juga kaget mendengar anggaran pulpen yang sempat diajukan hingga ratusan milliar. Menurut dia, anggaran pulpen hingga Rp 1 milliar tersebut pun sudah terlalu besar.
"Sekolah kami ada enam jenis pulpen. Paling mahal ball liner satunya bisa Rp 20 ribu."
Sekolah Dasar Negeri Kebon Pala 13 mengajukan anggaran Rp 4,178 juta untuk pembelian pulpen tahun depan. Pulpen tersebut, kata dia, bakal dimanfaatkan untuk 12 guru yang mengajar di SDN Kebon Pala 13.
Adapun untuk satu triwulan, SDN Kebon Pala 13 mengajukan pembelian ATK Rp 11,6 juta. "Pengajuannya sudah sejak Januari kemarin. Ada tiga jenis pulpen yang kami beli ball liner, drawing pen dan pilot."
Sedangkan, SDN Kebon Pala 14 mengajukan 8,9 juta untuk pembelian ATK pada triwulan terakhir ini. Kepala SDN Kebon Pala 14 Lulut Suparmi mengatakan belum bisa memberi tahu anggaran yang diajukan untuk pembelian pulpen tahun depan.
Namun, Lulut memperkirakan anggaran pembelian pulpen SDN Kebon Pala 14 tidak jauh berbeda dengan SDN Kebon Pala 13 karena mempunyai jumlah guru dan siswa yang hampir sama banyaknya.
"Saya tidak bisa melihat RKAS. Karena staf yang bisa buka datanya sedang ada di Sudin (Pendidikan Jaktim)."
Kepala Suku Dinas Pendidikan Jakarta Timur Ade Narun mengatakan tidak mengetahui adanya pengajuan anggaran Rp 123 miliar untuk pembelian pulpen dari lembaganya. Sebab, Ade baru satu bulan menjabat sebagai kepala di Sudin Pendidikan Jaktim. "Saya tidak tahu kalau ada anggaran itu. Setahu saya tidak ada," ujarnya.
Ade mengatakan anggaran pembelian ATK untuk sekitar 300 lebih sekolah negeri di Jaktim telah direvisi. Revisi, kata dia, telah mengerucut sekitar Rp 18 miliar untuk pembelian seluruh ATK termasuk pulpen. "Tapi detailnya saya tidak hafal. Kalau mau datanya di kantor. Sekarang saya lagi ada rapat di sekolah," kata Ade saat dihubungi.
Anggaran Rp 123 miliar untuk pembelian ballpoint dalam APBD DKI 2020 diungkap oleh Anggota DPRD dari Fraksi PSI, William Aditya Sarana. William juga menyoroti berbagai anggaran janggal lainnya dalam APBD DKI Jakarta seperti anggaran pembelian lem aibon sebesar Rp 82 miliar yang akhirnya dihapus.

The budget for the DKI APBD Ballpoint is Rp. 123 billion, Schools Open Votes
Nov 01 2019, 10:41 by Imam Hamdi, Febriyan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The budget for the purchase of a ballpoint in the draft of the 2020 DKI Regional Budget amounting to Rp 123 billion submitted by the East Jakarta Education Agency is in the spotlight. A number of schools that Tempo visited admitted that they did not understand why the stationery procurement budget could be that big.
Jakarta State High School 9 for example. These high schools in the Kebon Pala area of Makassar propose a pension budget of Rp 16.3 million for the 2020 work plan and school budget (RKAS).
Dwi Priyo School Principal Eko Santoso detailed the budget divided in two to purchase a ball liner pen of Rp. 10.49 million and a pen of Rp. 5.82 as well. The ball liner pens were submitted as many as five dozen times 12 and four packs of pens multiplied 12 months. "The pens are for 60 teachers who teach at our school," Eko said when met at his office, Thursday, November 1, 2019.
A administrative staff of SMAN 9, whose name did not want to be mentioned, said that the purchase of pens was included in the office stationery budget. The purchase of stationery is usually done every three months or quarterly.
Within a year for the purchase of all stationery, such as pens, markers, pencils, erasers, ink, paper and others, it could reach Rp 150 million. According to the administrative staff, the school that buys the most pens in one quarter is Rp. 1 million.
"That's a maximum of Rp. 1 million."
The staff was also surprised to hear the budget of the pen that had been proposed up to hundreds of billions. According to him, the pen budget up to Rp. 1 billion is already too large.
"Our school has six types of pens. The most expensive ball liner is only Rp 20 thousand."
Kebon Pala 13 Primary School submitted a budget of Rp. 4.178 million for the purchase of pens next year. The pen, he said, would be used for 12 teachers who teach at SDN Kebon Pala 13.
As for one quarter, SDN Kebon Pala 13 submitted an ATK purchase of IDR 11.6 million. "The submission has been made since January. There are three types of pens we bought ball liners, drawing pens and pilots."
Meanwhile, SDN Kebon Pala 14 submitted 8.9 million for the purchase of stationery in the last quarter. Head of Kebon Pala 14 Public Elementary School, Lulut Suparmi, said that he could not yet tell the budget proposed for the purchase of pens next year.
However, Lulut estimates that the budget for buying Kebon Pala 14 Public Elementary School pens is not much different from Kebon Pala 13 Public Elementary School because it has almost the same number of teachers and students.
"I can't see the RKAS. Because the staff who can open the data are at Sudin (East Jakarta Education)."
East Jakarta Education Agency Chief Ade Narun said that he was not aware of a budget submission of Rp. 123 billion for the purchase of pens from his institution. Because, Ade just served a month as head of East Jakarta Education Sub-dept. "I don't know if there is a budget. As far as I know there isn't," he said.
Ade said the budget for purchasing ATK for around 300 more public schools in East Jakarta had been revised. The revision, he said, had conceded around Rp. 18 billion for the purchase of all stationery including pens. "But the details I don't memorize. If you want the data in the office. Now I have a meeting at school," Ade said when contacted.
The budget of Rp. 123 billion for the purchase of ballpoints in the 2020 DKI APBD was revealed by a DPRD member from the PSI Faction, William Aditya Sarana. William also highlighted a variety of other odd budgets in the DKI Jakarta APBD such as the budget for buying aibon glue of Rp. 82 billion, which was eventually removed.
